</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The following 
discussion should be read in conjunction with our financial statements and the 
related notes contained elsewhere in this report and in our other filings with 
the Commission.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Recent 
Developments</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On May 26, 
2016,&#160;Profire announced that its Board of Directors had authorized a share 
repurchase program allowing the Company to repurchase up to $2,000,000 worth of 
the Company's common stock from time to time through May 25, 2017. Any purchases
under the program will be made at the discretion of management. The size and 
timing of any purchases will depend on price, market and business conditions and
other factors.&#160;Open market purchases will be conducted in accordance with 
applicable legal requirements. The repurchase program may be suspended, 
terminated or modified at any time for any reason, including market conditions, 
the cost of repurchasing shares, the availability of alternative investment 
opportunities, liquidity, and other factors deemed appropriate. These factors 
may also affect the timing and amount of share repurchases.&#160;The repurchase 
program does not obligate the Company to purchase any particular number of 
shares.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">On May 4, 2016, the 
Company issued a total of 59,953 restricted shares to one of its Independent 
Directors. The shares were issued in the settlement of previously granted and 
vested restricted stock units.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">Overview of Products 
&amp; Services</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Summary</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">We design, assemble, install, service, and sell oilfield-management
technologies. Our flagship products are burner-management systems that monitor 
and manage burners found throughout the industry. We believe our products 
provide major benefits to our customers including improved efficiency, increased
safety, and enhanced compliance with evolving industry regulation. We also sell 
related products such as flare ignition systems, fuel train components, 
secondary airplates, valve actuators, solar packages, and chemical-management 
systems. Our products and services aid oil and natural gas producers in the safe
and efficient production and transportation of oil and natural gas.</div>
<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Principal Products and 
Services</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In the oil and natural 
gas industry, there are numerous demands for heat generation and 
control.&#160;&#160;Oilfield vessels of all kinds, including line-heaters, 
dehydrators, separators, treaters, amine reboilers, and free-water knockout 
systems require heat to satisfy their various functions, which is provided by a 
burner flame inside the vessel.&#160;&#160;This burner flame is integral to the 
operation of the vessel because these vessels use the flame's heat to facilitate
the proper function of the vessel. Such functions include separating, storing, 
transporting and purifying oil and gas (or even water).&#160;&#160;For example, 
the viscosity of oil and moisture content (and temperature) of gas are critical 
to a number of oilfield processes, and are directly affected by the heat 
provided by the burner flame inside the vessel. Our burner-management systems 
help ignite, monitor, and manage this burner flame, reducing the need for 
employee interaction with the burner, such as for the purposes of re-ignition or
temperature monitoring.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">As a result, oil and 
gas producers can achieve increased safety, greater operational efficiencies, 
and improved compliance with changing industry regulations.&#160; We believe, 
despite the industry down turn, there is a growing trend in the oil and gas 
industry toward enhanced control, process automation, and data logging, partly 
for potential regulatory-satisfaction purposes. We continue to assess 
compliance-interest in the industry, especially given the budgetary constraints 
we have observed over the last year. We believe that enhanced burner-management 
products and services can help our customers be compliant with such regulatory 
requirements, where applicable. In addition to selling products, we train and 
dispatch service technicians to address this industry need in Canada and 
throughout the United States.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">19</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">After providing installation and maintenance services for several years, 
we decided to pursue the development of burner-management technologies, and we 
began work on a proprietary burner-management system to ignite, monitor, and 
manage the burner flames used in oilfield vessels.&#160; Our principal 
objectives in developing our proprietary burner-management system were to:</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="f705eb9221484f179842997e653eeae5" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">provide a safe, efficient and 
code-compliant method to ignite, monitor, and/or manage burner flames in the 
industry; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="e77472716e7c44c5b7243b1d0f4dc5a9" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">ensure the system could be 
easily controlled by oilfield operators.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">With
these objectives in mind, we initially developed our first burner-management 
system in 2005.&#160; Since 2005, we have released several iterations of our 
initial burner-management system, increasing features and capabilities, while 
maintaining compliance with Canadian Standards Association (CSA) and 
Underwriters Laboratories (UL) ratings.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Our 
burner-management systems have become widely used in Western Canada, and well-
received in the United States market, with sales to such companies as Anadarko, 
Chesapeake Energy, ConocoPhillips, Devon Energy, Encana, Exxon-Mobil, Petro-
Canada, Shell and others.&#160; Our systems have also been sold or installed in 
other parts of the world, including France, Italy, Ukraine, India, Nigeria, the 
Middle East, Australia, and Brazil. While we have an interest in expanding our 
long-run international distribution capabilities, our current principal focus is
on the North American oil and gas market.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Recent Product Extension: PF3100</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In September of 2015, 
the Company unveiled its next generation burner-management system which is 
designed to operate, monitor, and control more complex, multi-faceted oilfield 
applications. The newly announced management system, the PF3100, is an advanced 
management system designed to work with any number of Profire-engineered 
modules, specific to different applications, thus allowing the system to 
expertly manage a wide variety of applications and possibly whole new 
environments in future years.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Throughout the industry,
Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) are used to operate and manage custom-built
oilfield applications. Though capable, PLC's can be expensive, tedious, and 
difficult to use. Our unique solution, the PF3100, can help manage and 
synchronize custom applications helping oilfield producers meet deadlines and 
improve profitability through an off-the-shelf solution with dynamic 
customization.&#160; The Company has begun selling the PF3100 for initial use in
the oil and gas industry's natural-draft market, with additional modules, 
including forced-air modules, planned for the near-future.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">The Company frequently 
assesses market needs by participating in industry conferences and soliciting 
feedback from existing and potential customers and looks for opportunities to 
provide quality solutions to the oil and gas producing companies it serves. Upon
identifying a potential market need, the Company begins researching the market 
and developing products that might have feasibility for future sale.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">20</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Additional Complementary Products</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In addition to our 
burner-management systems, we also sell complementary oilfield products to help 
facilitate improved oilfield safety and efficiency. Such products help manage 
fuel flow (e.g., valves and fuel trains), meter air flow (e.g., airplates), 
generate power on-site (e.g., solar packages), ignite and direct flame (e.g., 
flare stack igniter and nozzles), and other necessary functions. We have 
invested heavily to develop innovative complementary products, which we 
anticipate will help bolster continued long-term growth.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Some of these products 
are resold from third parties (e.g., solar packages), while some are proprietary
(e.g., flare stack igniter) or patent-pending (e.g., inline pilot and valve 
technologies). We intend to continue developing proprietary products to help 
enhance our margin on some of these complementary products.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Chemical-Management Systems</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In addition to the 
burner-management systems and complementary technologies we have sold 
historically, we extended our product line by acquiring the assets of VIM 
Injection Management ("VIM") in November 2014, which extended our brand to 
include chemical-management systems.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Chemical injection is 
used for a wide variety of purposes in the oil and gas industry including down-
hole inhibition of wax, hydrates, and corrosion agents, so that product can flow
more efficiently to the wellhead. Once at the wellhead, chemical injection can 
also be used to further process the oil or gas before it is sent into a 
pipeline, and with other applications.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Currently, a variety of 
pumps are used to meter the chemicals injected, but are often inaccurate in 
injecting the proper amount of chemical, as they may not account for all of the
variables that affect how much chemical should be injected (e.g., pressure, 
hydrogen sulfide concentration, etc.) nor the optimal efficiency rates of 
varying pump systems.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Inaccurate injection 
levels are problematic because the chemicals injected are expensive; over-
injection causes unnecessary expense for producers. However, under-injection can
often result in the creation of poor product (i.e., with wax, hydrate, or 
corrosion agents) and cause problems with pipeline audits.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Our chemical-management 
systems monitor and manage this chemical-injection process to ensure that 
optimal levels of chemicals are injected. This improves the efficiency of the 
pump and production quality of the well, improves safety for workers that would 
otherwise be exposed to these chemicals, and improves compliance with pipeline 
operators. Like our burner-management systems, our chemical-management systems 
can be monitored and managed remotely via SCADA or other remote-communication 
systems. A patent was issued domestically related to our chemical management 
system and its process for supplying a chemical agent to a process fluid.&#160; 
Other international patents are pending.</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">21</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">Results of 
Operations</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><u>Comparison of the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Total Revenues</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Total revenues during 
the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> $<font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">2,903,200 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">42%</font>, compared to the comparable
period ended June 30, 2015.&#160; This decrease was principally attributable to 
decreased sales of goods, net, as well as decreased sales of services, 
net.&#160; Though we expect to continue to deal with a difficult industry 
environment for some time, we are focusing our resources in geographic areas 
that we believe will produce the highest level of total revenues and return on 
investment.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT: italic 10pt/12.3pt 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Sales of Goods, Net</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Sales of goods, net 
during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> $<font
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">2,749,077 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">44%</font>, compared to the comparable
period ended June 30, 2015. This decrease was principally attributable to the 
reduced purchasing from companies in the oil and gas industry stemming from 
budget constraints due to the drastic decline in the underlying commodity prices
year over year.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT: italic 10pt/12.3pt 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Sales of Services, Net</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Sales of services, net 
during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> $<font
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">154,123 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">23%</font>, compared to the comparable 
period ended June 30, 2015. The decrease in sales of services, net, was 
principally attributable to the decrease in overall purchasing by our customers,
as services are generally provided on the installation of newly purchased 
systems. Although the primary purpose of our service team is to support product 
sales, our service team also provides valuable feedback for our sales and 
research and development teams as well as a number of auxiliary services for our
customers.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT:
36pt"><u>Total Cost of Goods Sold</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Total cost of goods sold
during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> $<font
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">1,503,664 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">42%</font>, compared to the comparable
period ended June 30, 2015.&#160; As a percentage of total revenues, total cost 
of goods sold was 52% during the three months ended June 30, 2016 and 
2015.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT: italic 10pt/12.3pt 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Cost of Goods Sold-Products</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Cost of goods sold-
products during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">decreased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">1,255,275</font> or <font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">42%</font>, compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015, 
primarily as a result of decreased sales. As a percentage of revenues from 
product sales, cost of goods sold-products increased to 50% during the three 
months ended June 30, 2016, compared to 48% for the comparable period ended June
30, 2015. This change is largely attributable to the improved allocation of 
overhead costs of some product-related fixed assets associated with storage and 
inventory management.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Given the current and 
expected industry conditions in the oil and gas industry, we have been and will 
continue to work with our suppliers to control our inventory costs, which has 
the largest impact on margin.&#160; We have been relatively successful in 
maintaining our price during the industry volatility, though customers have 
sought prices reductions.&#160; We anticipate holding prices relatively stable, 
within the confines of normal sales operations. We anticipate returning to a 
more historical margin in the long-run, especially with increased sales, though 
quarterly results will vary. We expect this migration to historical margin 
levels will take several quarters.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">22</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT: italic 10pt/12.3pt 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Cost of Goods Sold-Services</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Cost of goods sold-
services during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">decreased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">248,388 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">42%</font>, 
compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015, as a result of decreased 
sales of service.&#160; As a percentage of service revenues, cost of goods sold-
service <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">68%</font> during the 
three months ended June 30, 2016, compared to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">90%</font> for the
comparable period ended June 30, 2015. The change in cost of goods sold-service 
was achieved by cost cutting measures to right size our service division for the
current industry context and make it more profitable.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Gross Profit</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Gross profit during the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 remained unchanged at <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">48%</font> 
compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Total Operating Expenses</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Our total operating 
expenses during the three months ended June 30, 2016 decreased $<font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">1,057,556 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">27%</font>, compared to the comparable
period ended June 30, 2015.&#160; As a percentage of total revenues, total 
operating expenses during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">increased</font> from <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">56%</font> to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">70%</font>, 
compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015. Despite significant 
efforts to control and manage operating costs which brought total operating 
costs down by 27%, revenue declined 42% which caused total operating expenses as
a percentage of total revenues to increase sharply.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>General and Administrative Expenses</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">General and 
administrative expenses during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">decreased</font> by $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">1,055,573 </font>or <font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">31%</font> compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015.&#160;
As a percentage of total operating expenses, general and administrative expenses
during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">decreased</font> from 
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000">89%</font> to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">85%</font> compared to the comparable 
period ended June 30, 2015. The decrease in overall costs were due to cost 
management and reduction efforts in professional fees, sales and marketing 
expenses, stock based compensation, travel and payroll costs.&#160; We will 
continue to closely evaluate expenses and determine what expense-reduction 
actions, if any, need to be taken.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Research and Development</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Research and development
expenses during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">decreased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">53,767 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">18%</font>, 
compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015.&#160; As a percentage of 
total operating expenses, research and development expenses during the three 
months ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">increased</font> from <font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">8%</font> to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">9%</font> compared to the comparable 
period ended June 30, 2015.&#160; This decrease in total cost was due to cost
cutting efforts across the department while maintaining the prioritization of 
research and development projects.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Depreciation and Amortization Expense</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Depreciation and 
amortization expense during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">increased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">51,784 </font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">48%</font>, 
compared to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015. As a percentage of total 
operating expenses, depreciation <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">increased</font> from <font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">2.8%</font> to <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">5.7%</font> due to the decrease in the 
allocation of depreciation to cost of goods sold mostly related to operational 
changes made to the service department.<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">23</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Total Other Income (Expense)</u></div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: normal; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Total other income during the three months ended June 30, 2016 <font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">increased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">99,336 </font>compared to the comparable 
period ended June 30, 2015. The majority of this increase is due to the impact 
of Foreign Exchange gains and losses in each period.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Net Income (Loss) Before Income Taxes</u></div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">The decreases we realized in total 
revenues, gross profit and total operating expenses combined to lead to a net 
<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000">loss</font> before income taxes during the three months ended 
June 30, 2016 of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">851,172 </font>compared to net <font style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">loss</font> before income taxes of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">608,527 </font>during 
to the comparable period ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><u>Income Tax Expense 
(Benefit)</u></div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">Income tax benefit during the three months 
ended June 30, 2016 <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">increased</font> $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">96,163 
</font>or <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">64%</font>, compared to the comparable period ended June 
30, 2015. The increase was due to the larger net loss before tax during the 
period and due to changes in various deferred tax items.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><u>Foreign Currency 
Translation Gain (Loss)</u></div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 39.6pt">Our consolidated 
financial statements are presented in United States dollars ("USD").&#160; Our 
functional currencies are the USD and the Canadian dollar ("CAD").&#160; 
Transactions initiated in other currencies are translated to USD using period
ending exchange rates for the balance sheet and weighted average exchange rates 
for the statements of operations.&#160; Equity transactions were translated 
using historical rates. Therefore, the translation adjustment in our 
consolidated financial statements represents the translation differences from 
translation of our financial statements. As a result, the translation adjustment
is commonly, but not always, positive if the average exchange rates are lower 
than exchange rates on the date of the financial statements and negative if the 
average exchange rates are higher than exchange rates on the date of the 
financial statements. Foreign currency translation gains or losses as a result 
of fluctuations in the exchange rates are reflected in the Statement of 
Operations and Other Comprehensive Income (Loss).</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">We recognized a foreign 
currency translation <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">gain</font> of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">773 
</font>during the three months ended June 30, 2016.&#160; By comparison, during 
the three months ended June 30, 2015 we recognized a <font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">gain</font> 
of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000">333,372</font> in foreign currency translation. The changes in 
translation gain were the result of volatility in foreign exchange rates, 
specifically between the USD and CAD.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Total Comprehensive Income (Loss)</u></div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">For the foregoing 
reasons, we realized a total comprehensive <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">loss</font> during the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">604,522 </font>compared to 
total comprehensive <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">loss</font> of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">125,441 
</font>during the comparable period ended June 30, 2015.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">Liquidity and Capital 
Resources</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Total current assets were 
$<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000">36,009,3</font><a name="_GoBack"><!--Anchor--></a><font
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">36 </font>and total assets were $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">45,936,465 
</font>including cash and cash equivalents of $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">22,043,090 
</font>at June 30, 2016.&#160; Total current liabilities were $979,362 and total
liabilities were $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">1,612,094 </font>at June 30, 2016. Working capital
at June 30, 2016 was $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">35,029,974 </font>compared to $<font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">35,205,517 </font>at March 31, 2016.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">24</div>

<div style="CLEAR: both; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; CLEAR: both; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Net cash provided by our operating activities was $<font style="FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">736,681</font>. During the three months ended June 30, 2016 we realized
an increase in cash primarily derived from changes in accounts receivable and 
inventory. These increases were partially offset by decreases in cash resulting 
from our net <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">loss</font> and a significant pay down of accounts
payable and accrued liabilities during the period.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt"><font 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab" style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">During the three months ended June 30, 2016, net cash provided by 
investing activities was </font>$<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">16,896 </font>and was primarily
driven by proceeds from disposal of equipment during the period. We do not have 
plans to make significant purchases of fixed assets in the short-term.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">During the three months 
ended June 30, 2016, no cash was received in financing activities for the 
issuance of stock options.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">As a result of the net 
cash provided from operating and investing activities, we realized a net <font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">increase</font> in cash during the three months ended June 30, 2016 of 
$<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000">750,495 </font>compared to a $<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000">3,041,442 
</font>net <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">increase</font> during the three months ended June 30, 
2015.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">Item 3.&#160; Quantitative
and Qualitative Disclosure about Market Risk</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">We are exposed to 
certain market risks in the ordinary course of business. These risks result 
primarily from changes in foreign currency exchange rates and interest rates. In
addition, international operations are subject to risks related to differing 
economic conditions, changes in political climate, differing tax structures and 
other regulations and restrictions.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">To date we have not 
utilized derivative financial instruments or derivative commodity instruments. 
We do not expect to employ these or other strategies to hedge market risk in the
foreseeable future. Cash is held in checking, savings, and money market funds,
which are subject to minimal credit and market risk. We believe that the market 
risks associated with these financial instruments are immaterial, although there
can be no guarantee that these market risks will be immaterial to us.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Item 4.&#160; Controls 
and Procedures</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt"><u>Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">Our management, with 
the participation of the principal executive officer and principal financial 
officer, evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of our 
disclosure controls and procedures pursuant to Rule 13a-15(b) under the 
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 as of the end of the period covered by this 
Report. Based on this evaluation, the principal executive officer and principal 
financial officer concluded that as of the end of the period covered by this 
Report, our disclosure and control procedures were not effective due to material
weaknesses identified as part of fiscal year 2016 year-end review of internal 
controls over financial reporting. A material weakness is a control deficiency, 
or combination of control deficiencies, in internal control over financial 
reporting such that there is a reasonable possibility that a material 
misstatement of the registrant's annual or interim financial statements will not
be prevented or detected on a timely basis.<font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000"> For more information 
on material weaknesses identified by management during our internal assessment, 
see our Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.</font></div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">25</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Changes in Internal Control over Financial 
Reporting</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">There was no change in our internal control over financial reporting 
during the period covered by this report that has materially affected, or is 
reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial 
reporting.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Management's Remediation Initiatives</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Management has been actively developing a remediation plan and been 
implementing new controls and processes to address the aforementioned 
deficiencies. Upon receiving the results of our internal controls review, we 
have taken actions to strengthen our internal control structure, including the 
following:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">
</div>
<table id="76613642f023436285ffb7453da8b257" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 54pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#183;</font><font id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab" 
style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Hired third parties to provide advice on COSO framework 
and risk control matrices;</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 54pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#183;</font><font id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab" 
style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Implemented company-wide trainings over internal controls
in relation with new accounting standard operating procedures including the 
requirement of supplying supporting evidence, proving the level of precision 
with which a control is performed, etc.;</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 54pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#183;</font><font id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab" 
style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Required evidence of review in nearly all controls; 
and</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 54pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Symbol, serif; COLOR: #000000">&#183;</font><font id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab" 
style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Reviewed and updated each employee's access within the 
enterprise resource management system.</font></div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">Management continues to meet with key managers and control owners to 
evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls and to ensure implementation of 
remediation initiatives.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><u>Limitations on the Effectiveness of Internal 
Controls</u></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">An internal control 
system, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only reasonable, 
not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met. 
Further, the design of a control system must reflect the fact that there are 
resource constraints, and the benefits of controls must be considered relative 
to their costs. Because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no 
evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues 
and instances of fraud, if any, within the Company have been detected. These 
inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in decision-making can
be faulty, and that breakdowns can occur because of simple error or mistake.
Additionally, controls can be circumvented by the individual acts of some 
persons, by collusion of two or more people, or by management override of the 
internal control. The design of any system of controls also is based in part 
upon certain assumptions about the likelihood of future events, and there can be
no assurance that any design will succeed in achieving its stated goals under 
all potential future conditions. Over time, a control may become inadequate 
because of changes in conditions, or the degree of compliance with the policies 
or procedures may deteriorate.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">26</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
<hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 
100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.8pt">PART II - OTHER 
INFORMATION</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 45pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: -45pt">Item 1. Legal Proceedings</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">To the best of our knowledge, there are no legal 
proceedings pending or threatened against us; and there are no actions pending 
or threatened against any of our directors or officers that are adverse to 
us.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item 1A.&#160; Risk Factors</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In addition to the 
other information set forth in this quarterly report on Form10-Q, you should 
carefully consider the risks discussed in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the
year ended March 31, 2016, which risks could materially affect our business, 
financial condition or future results. These risks are not the only risks facing
our Company. Additional risks and uncertainties not currently known to us or 
that we currently deem to be immaterial also may materially adversely affect our
business, financial condition or future results.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">&#160;</div>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Item 2.&#160; Unregistered
Sales of Equity Securities and Use of Proceeds</div>
<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
36pt">As previously reported, on June 26, 2014, the SEC declared effective our 
registration statement on Form S-1 (File No. 333-196462).&#160; The registration
statement related to 6,000,000 shares of our common stock; 4,500,000 shares were
sold by the Company and 1,500,000 shares were sold by certain selling 
stockholders.&#160; On July 2, 2014, we sold 4,500,000 shares of our common 
stock at the price of $4.00 per share, for an aggregate sale price of 
$18,000,000.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
24.5pt">We expect to use the proceeds from this offering for expansion of our 
sales and service team to match the demand for our product in regions where 
legislation has passed, requiring the use of our technology, and for other 
working capital purposes. We may also use a portion of the net proceeds to fund 
possible investments in, or acquisitions of, complementary businesses, solutions
or technologies. In addition, the amount and timing of what we actually spend 
for these purposes may vary significantly and will depend on a number of 
factors, including our future revenue and cash generated by operations and other
factors.&#160; Accordingly, our management will have discretion and flexibility 
in applying the net proceeds of this offering. Pending any uses, as described 
above, we intend to invest the net proceeds in high quality, investment grade, 
short-term fixed income instruments which include corporate, financial 
institution, federal agency or U.S. government obligations.</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 0pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 0pt">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; CLEAR:
both">
<div id="DSPFPageNumberArea" style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-ALIGN: center">27</div>
<div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

</div>

WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">PROFIRE ENERGY, INC.</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt;

 &#160;</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">

<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER PURSUANT TO RULE 13A-
14(A)
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>

<body style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif" 
text="#000000" bgcolor="#ffffff">
<div style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: right">EXHIBIT 31.1</div>
<div>
<hr style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; BORDER-
TOP: black 4px solid; COLOR: #ffffff; HEIGHT: 10px; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; MARGIN-
RIGHT: auto; text-align: center; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageFooter">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">&#160;</div>
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">CERTIFICATION OF 
PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">Pursuant to Rule 13a-14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">I, Brenton W. Hatch, 
certify that:</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">1.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif">I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Profire Energy, 
Inc.;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">2.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any 
untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary 
to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such 
statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">3.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and 
other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all 
material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows 
of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif">4.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">The registrant's other certifying officers and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial 
reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the 
registrant and have:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="3656f6e133ae4a05a89cf1547be782f1" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">a)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Designed such 
disclosure controls and procedures or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="c26fd68174194701b5461021e2e59bf0" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">b)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Designed such 
internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over 
financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable 
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation 
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally 
accepted accounting principles;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="81cd64202d6b4b728cef134a9457d519" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">c)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Evaluated the 
effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and 
presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="edc1c5a42a8b4a99b9fdc65aa96d6a83" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">d)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Disclosed in this report any 
change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that 
occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's 
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's 
internal control over financial reporting; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">5.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">The registrant's other certifying officer and I have 
disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over 
financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the
registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="6468f99a17e6455b85e2ff003d4cdf46" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">a)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">All significant 
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal 
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="a2e7f519722744a09352ca5a72547018" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">b)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Any fraud, 
whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a 
significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial 
reporting.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<table id="0c4be9382e874235aebd91bcf9dc474a" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 8.27%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Date:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 28.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">August 10, 2016</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 6.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">By:</div>
</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-VARIANT: 
normal; WIDTH: 57.28%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: 
normal; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: "><u>&#160;/s/Brenton W. Hatch</u></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 8.27%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 28.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 6.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 57.28%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Brenton W. Hatch</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr style="HEIGHT: 19px">
<td style="WIDTH: 8.27%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 28.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 6.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 57.28%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">Chief Executive Officer</div>
</td>
</tr>
