<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.2
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>exh31_2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER PURSUANT TO RULE 13A-
14(A)
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>
<!--Licensed to: southr1
    Document created using EDGARfilings PROfile 3.6.0.0
    Copyright 1995 - 2016 Summit Financial Printing, LLC.  All rights 
reserved.-->
</head>
<body style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif" 
text="#000000" bgcolor="#ffffff">
<div style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: right">EXHIBIT 31.2</div>
<div>
<hr style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; BORDER-
TOP: black 4px solid; COLOR: #ffffff; HEIGHT: 10px; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; MARGIN-
RIGHT: auto; text-align: center; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
</div>
<div id="DSPFPageFooter"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
 &#160;</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">CERTIFICATION OF 
PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 
12.55pt">Pursuant to Rule 13a-14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">I, Ryan W. Oviatt, 
certify that:</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">1.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Profire Energy, 
Inc.;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">2.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any 
untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary 
to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such 
statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">3.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and 
other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all 
material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows 
of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-
INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif">4.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif">The registrant's other certifying officers and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial 
reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the 
registrant and have:</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="951712fd31634e73bd3fa79ffa53885b" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">a)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Designed such 
disclosure controls and procedures or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="e4a248c81a3c40fcbb057ed1f4d934ed" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">b)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Designed such 
internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over 
financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable 
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation 
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally 
accepted accounting principles;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="b2a79589e21541638fe9a5c4425ea3e6" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; align: right">c)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Evaluated the 
effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and 
presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="b728a1e9df2b406d98b07203a76da047" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-

<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>

36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">d)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Disclosed in this report any 
change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that 
occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's 
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's 
internal control over financial reporting; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000">5.</font><font style="FONT-SIZE:
5.14pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; COLOR: #000000">The registrant's other certifying officer and I have 
disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over 
financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the
registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="9221a50aa036461c914c49aeb6be6be5" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-

<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>

<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:

control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial 
information; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div>
<table id="fe0688e465f34d828b880794e8f93cfc" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-

<div>

1350,</div>

TO</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; TEXT-
ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt">In connection with this
quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Profire Energy, Inc. (the "Company") for the 
period ended June 30, 2016, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
on the date hereof (the <font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-STYLE: italic">"Report"</font>), I, Ryan W. Oviatt, 
Principal Financial Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 
Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 
2002, that:</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="b0475f0ba99d4d43bff82c3df8044ca9" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(1)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">The Report fully complies with 
the requirements of section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 
1934; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
<table id="7ff557a79c514cedb5ac5f6d90c0e750" class="DSPFListTable" style="FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH: 100%" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(2)</td>
<td style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; WIDTH:
auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">The information contained in the
Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and 
results of operations of the Company.</td>

egx--&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 1 - 
CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;The accompanying financial statements have been prepared 
by the Company without audit.&amp;#160; In the opinion of management, all 
adjustments (which include only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the financial position, results of operations and cash flows at 
June 30, 2016 and for all periods presented have been made.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Certain 
information and footnote disclosures normally included in financial statements 
prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the 
United States of America have been condensed or omitted. It is suggested that 
these condensed consolidated financial statements be read in conjunction with 
the financial statements and notes thereto included in the Company&apos;s March 
31, 2016 audited financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations for 
the periods ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 are not necessarily indicative of the 
operating results for the full years.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CondensedFinancialStatementsTextBlock>
<us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--
egx--&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 
&amp;#150; ORGANIZATION AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING 
POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;This Organization 
and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies of Profire Energy, Inc. and 
Subsidiary (the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;) is presented to assist in 
understanding the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial statements. 
&amp;nbsp;The Company&amp;#146;s accounting policies conform to accounting 
principles generally accepted in the United States of America (US GAAP).
&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;Profire Energy, Inc. was established on October 9, 2008 
upon the closing of an Acquisition Agreement between The Flooring Zone, Inc. and
Profire Combustion, Inc. and the shareholders of Profire Combustion, Inc. (the 
&amp;#147;Subsidiary&amp;#148;). &amp;#160;&amp;#160;Following the closing of 
the agreement The Flooring Zone, Inc. was renamed Profire Energy, Inc. (the 
&amp;#147;Parent&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Pursuant to the terms
and conditions of the Acquisition Agreement, 35,000,000 shares of restricted 
common stock of the Company were issued to the three shareholders of the 
Subsidiary in exchange for all of the issued and outstanding shares of the 
Subsidiary. As a result of the transaction, the Subsidiary became a wholly-owned
subsidiary of the Parent and the shareholders of the Subsidiary became the 
controlling shareholders of the Company. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Organization and Line of 
Business&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Parent was 
incorporated on May 5, 2003 in the State of Nevada. The Subsidiary was 
incorporated on March 6, 2002 in the province of Alberta, Canada. 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company provides burner and chemical management 
products and services for the oil and gas industry in the Canadian and US 
markets. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reclassification&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Certain balances 
in previously issued consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to
be consistent with the current period presentation.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The preparation of financial 
statements in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the 
United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions 
that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and 
the reportable amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. 
Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Principles of 
Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The consolidated financial statements include our wholly-
owned subsidiary. Intercompany balances and transactions have been
eliminated.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic and Diluted Loss Per 
Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The computation of basic loss per share of common stock 
is based on the weighted average number of shares outstanding during the periods
presented using the treasury stock method. The computation of fully diluted loss
per share includes common stock equivalents outstanding at the balance sheet 
date. As of June 30, 2016 and 2015 the Company had 332,794 and 69,190 common 
stock equivalents from equity awards that have been excluded from the 
calculation of diluted loss per share as their effect would have been anti-
dilutive. Basic and diluted loss per share are as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table

5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-

style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:right&apos;&gt;$&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;17%&quot; 
valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:17.46%;border:none;border-

5.4pt;height:16.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot;
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:right&apos;&gt;(0.01)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Foreign Currency and 
Comprehensive Income&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The&amp;nbsp;functional&amp;nbsp;currency&amp;nbsp;of&amp
;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;Company&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;its&amp;nbsp;subsidiaries&amp;n
bsp;in&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;U.S.&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;Canada&amp;nbsp;are&amp;
nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;U.S.&amp;nbsp;Dollar&amp;nbsp;
(&amp;quot;USD&amp;quot;)&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;Canadian&amp;nbsp;D
ollar&amp;nbsp;(&amp;quot;CAD&amp;quot;),&amp;nbsp;respectively. &amp;#160;The 
financial statements of the Company were translated to USD using period end 
exchange rates for the balance sheet, and average exchange rates for the 
statements of operations.&amp;#160; Equity transactions
 were translated using historical rates.&amp;#160; The period-end exchange rates
of 0.772081 and 0.7711 were used to convert the Company&amp;#146;s June 30, 2016
and March 31, 2016 balance sheets, respectively, and the statements of 
operations used weighted average rates of 0.772962 and 0.811950 for the three 
months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively. All amounts in the financial 
statements and footnotes are presumed to be stated in USD, unless otherwise 
identified. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Foreign currency translation gains or losses as a result 
of fluctuations in the exchange rates are reflected in the Consolidated 
Statement of Operations and Comprehensive Income (Loss), and the Consolidated 
Statements of Stockholders&amp;#146; Equity.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair Value of Financial 
Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The fair value of a financial instrument is the amount 
that could be received upon the sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability
in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement 
date.&amp;nbsp;Financial assets are marked to bid prices and financial 
liabilities are marked to offer prices.&amp;nbsp;Fair value measurements do not 
include transaction costs.&amp;nbsp;A fair value hierarchy is used to prioritize
the quality and reliability of the information used to determine fair 
values.&amp;nbsp;Categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based on the 
lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value 
measurement.&amp;nbsp;The fair value hierarchy is defined into the following 
three categories:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 1: Quoted market prices in active markets for 
identical assets or liabilities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 2: Observable market-based inputs or inputs that 
are corroborated by market data.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 3: Unobservable inputs that are not corroborated by
market data.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Fair value 
estimates of financial instruments are made at a specific point in time, based 
on relevant information about financial markets and specific financial 
instruments. As these estimates are subjective in nature, involving 
uncertainties and matters of significant judgment, they cannot be determined 
with precision. &amp;nbsp;Changes in assumptions can significantly affect 
estimated fair value.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The carrying value
of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued liabilities 
approximate their fair value because of the short-term nature of these 
instruments. Management is of the opinion that the Company is not exposed to 
significant interest or credit risks arising from these financial 
instruments.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;For purposes of the statement of cash 
flows, cash and cash equivalents include cash and all debt securities with an 
original maturity of 90 days or less. As of June 30, 2016 and March 31, 2016, 
cash and cash equivalents totaled $22,043,090 and $21,292,595 respectively. 
&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Accounts 
Receivable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Receivables from the sale of goods and services are 
stated at net realizable value. This value includes an appropriate allowance for
estimated uncollectible accounts. &amp;nbsp;The allowance is calculated based on
past collectability and customer relationships. &amp;nbsp;The Company recorded 
an allowance for doubtful accounts of $268,464 and $250,646 as of June 30, 2016 
and March 31, 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventories&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;In accordance with ARB No. 43 
&lt;i&gt;&amp;#147;Inventory Pricing,&amp;#148;&lt;/i&gt; the Company&amp;#146;s
inventory is valued at the lower of cost (the purchase price, including 
additional fees) or market based on using the entire value of inventory. 
&amp;nbsp;Inventories are determined based on the average cost basis.&amp;#160; 
Inventory consists of finished goods held for sale and includes the 
following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; 
cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;

width=&quot;32%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; 
style=&apos;width:32.46%;background:white;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 
5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot;

align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160
;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;

;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 10,201,271 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td

;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;

&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;27%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot;

;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; (229,919)&lt;/p&gt;

style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-

style=&apos;width:32.46%;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext

align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-

;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160
;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; (237,998)&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr 
style=&apos;height:15.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;35%&quot; 
valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:35.28%;background:white;padding:0in 
5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt&apos;&gt;Total&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td 
width=&quot;27%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; 
style=&apos;width:27.88%;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;background:white;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.75pt&apos;&gt; 
&lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#16
0;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 9,971,352 &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td 
width=&quot;4%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; 
style=&apos;width:4.38%;background:white;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 
5.4pt;height:15.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td 
width=&quot;32%&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; 
style=&apos;width:32.46%;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;background:white;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:15.75pt&apos;&gt; 
&lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#16
0;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 11,046,682 &lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Long-
Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;We periodically 
review the carrying amount of our long-lived assets for impairment.&amp;nbsp;An 
asset is considered impaired when estimated future cash flows are less than the 
asset&amp;#146;s carrying amount.&amp;nbsp;In the event the carrying amount of 
such asset is not considered recoverable, the asset is adjusted to its fair 
value.&amp;nbsp;Fair value is generally determined based on discounted future 
cash flow.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Other Intangible Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font 
style=&apos;background:white&apos;&gt;The
 Company accounts for Other Intangible Assets under the guidance of ASC 350, 
&amp;#147;Intangibles&amp;#151;Goodwill and Other&amp;#148;. The Company 
capitalizes certain costs related to patent technology, as a substantial portion
of the purchase price related to the Company&amp;#146;s acquisition of VIM 
assets has been assigned to patents.&amp;#160; Under the guidance, Other 
Intangible Assets with definite lives are amortized over their estimated useful 
lives. Intangible assets with indefinite lives are tested annually for 
impairment.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;font 
style=&apos;background:white&apos;&gt;Goodwill&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Goodwill, representing the difference 
between the total purchase price and the fair value of assets (tangible and 
intangible) and liabilities at the date of acquisition, is reviewed for 
impairment annually, and more frequently as circumstances warrant, and written 
down only in the period in which the recorded value of such assets exceed their 
fair value.&amp;nbsp;The Company does not amortize goodwill in accordance with 
Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) Accounting 
Standards Codification (&amp;#147;ASC&amp;#148;) 350, 
&amp;#147;Intangibles&amp;#151;Goodwill and Other&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC 
350&amp;#148;).&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-top:9.0pt;margin-right:4.5pt;margin-bottom:0in;margin-
left:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;Goodwill is tested for impairment at the
reporting unit level.&amp;nbsp;The Company&amp;#146;s two operating segments 
comprise the reporting unit for goodwill impairment testing purposes.&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue 
Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The Company records sales when a firm sales agreement is 
in place, delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, and 
collectability of the fixed or determinable sales price is reasonably 
assured.&amp;#160; If customer acceptance of products is not assured, the 
Company records sales only upon formal customer acceptance.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cost of 
Sales&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company 
includes product costs (i.e. material, direct labor and overhead costs), 
shipping and handling expense, production-related depreciation expense and 
product license agreement expense in cost of sales.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Advertising Costs &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company 
classifies expenses for advertising as general and administrative 
expenses.&amp;#160; The Company incurred advertising costs of $32,141 and 
$20,240 during the three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, 
respectively.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-
Based Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company 
follows the provisions of ASC 718, &amp;#147;Share-Based Payment.&amp;#148; 
which requires all share-based payments to employees, including grants of
employee stock options, to be recognized in the income statement based on their 
fair values.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company uses the Black-Scholes pricing model
for determining the fair value of stock based compensation.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The Parent is subject to US income 
taxes on a stand-alone basis.&amp;#160; The Parent and its Subsidiary file 
separate stand-alone tax returns in each jurisdiction in which they 
operate.&amp;#160; The Subsidiary is a corporation operating in Canada and is 
subject to Canadian income taxes on its stand-alone taxable income.&amp;#160; 
The effective rates of income tax expense (benefit) are (29%) and (25%) for the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company 
utilizes an asset and liability approach for financial accounting and reporting 
for income taxes. Deferred income taxes are provided for temporary differences 
in the basis of assets and liabilities as reported for financial statement and 
income tax purposes.&amp;nbsp;Deferred income taxes reflect the tax effects of 
net operating loss and tax credit carryovers and temporary differences between 
the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes 
and the amounts used for income tax purposes.&amp;nbsp;Realization of certain 
deferred tax assets is dependent upon future earnings, if any. The Company makes
estimates and judgments in determining the need for a provision for income 
taxes, including the estimation of our taxable income for each full fiscal 
year.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Research and Development&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;All costs 
associated with research and development are expensed when incurred.&amp;#160; 
Costs incurred for research and development were $250,722 and $304,489 for the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Shipping 
and Handling Fees and Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company 
records all amounts billed to customers related to shipping and handling fees as
revenue.&amp;#160; The Company classifies expenses for shipping and handling 
costs as cost of goods sold.&amp;#160; The Company incurred shipping and 
handling costs of $37,715 and $85,326 during the three months ended June 30, 
2016 and 2015, respectively.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Comprehensive Income (Loss)&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Comprehensive 
income (loss) includes net income (loss) as currently reported by the Company 
adjusted for other comprehensive items. Other comprehensive items for the 
Company consist of foreign currency translation gains and losses and unrealized 
holding gains and losses on available for sale securities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company has 
evaluated recent accounting pronouncements and their adoption has not had or is 
not expected to have a material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s financial 
position, results of operations or cash flows. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property 
and Equipment Useful Lives&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Property and equipment is stated at 
cost. &amp;nbsp;Depreciation on property and equipment is computed using the 
diminishing balance method over the estimated useful lives of the assets. 
&amp;nbsp;The estimated useful lives of the assets are as follows:&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table 
border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; 
style=&apos;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-
collapse:collapse;border:none&apos;&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td
width=&quot;180&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; 
style=&apos;width:135.0pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;395&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; 
style=&apos;width:296.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Estimated useful 
life&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr 
align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;180&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;

align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Furniture and fixtures&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;180&quot; 
valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:135.0pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 
5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-

&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;395&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; 
style=&apos;width:296.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;3 Years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; 
&lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;180&quot; 
valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:135.0pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 
5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Software&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;395&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; 
style=&apos;width:296.5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;2 Years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; 
&lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Beginning in 
fiscal year 2016, we revised the estimated useful lives from 5 to 7 years for 
furniture and fixtures, and machinery and equipment, 25 to 30 years for 
buildings, 3 to 5 years for vehicles, and added a software asset type that has a
useful life of 2 years.&amp;#160; The change in depreciable lives is considered 
a change in accounting estimate on a prospective basis from April 1, 2015 and 
had an immaterial impact on overall financial statements for the period ended 
June 30, 2016. &lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>

compensation expense was recorded in prior years.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

<us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 5 &amp;#150; INTANGIBLE
ASSETS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;Definite-lived intangible assets consist
of distribution agreements, patents, trademarks, copyrights, and domain names. 
The costs of distribution agreements are amortized over the remaining life of 
agreements.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;The costs of the patents are to be 
amortized over 20 years once the patent has been approved.&amp;#160; Indefinite-
lived intangible assets consist of goodwill.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;In accordance with ASC 350, Goodwill is 
not amortized but tested for impairment annually or more frequently when events 
or circumstances indicates that the carrying value of a reporting unit more 
likely than not exceeds its fair value.&amp;#160; The Company&amp;#146;s annual 
goodwill impairment testing date is March 31 of each year. Intangible assets 
consisted of the following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p

assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot;

gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock>
<us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 7 &amp;#150; STOCK BASED 
COMPENSATION&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;On May 25, 2016 the Company granted a 
total of 315,500 stock options to employees.&amp;#160; The options vest 1/3 each
year for 3 years, with the first vesting occurring on the first anniversary of 
the vesting date. The Company estimates the fair value of each option award at 
the grant date by using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;Additionally, the Company granted 15,000
RSUs to Ryan Oviatt, the Company CFO vesting immediately on the date of grant, 
pursuant to his employment agreement. The Company estimates the fair value of 
the RSUs at their intrinsic value at the time of granting.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;The Company recognized $143,765 and 
$187,406 in expense for the fair value of previously granted stock based 
compensation vested during the three months ended June 30, 2016, and 2015, 
respectively. Stock compensation expense is recognized on a pro-rata basis over 
the vesting period of the equity awards. During the three month periods ended 
June 30, 2016 the Company recognized $143,765 in compensation expense arising 
from equity awards issued, leaving $1,142,898 of compensation expense on equity
awards to be recognized subsequent to June 30, 2016.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;A summary of the status of the 
Company&amp;#146;s stock option plans and the changes during each period are 
presented below:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table

<us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--
&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 8 &amp;#150; SUBSEQUENT 
EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;background:white&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;On July&amp;nbsp;18, 2016, Mr. Stephen E. Pirnat notified
(the &amp;quot;Company&amp;quot;) of his decision not to stand for re-election 
to the Company&apos;s Board of Directors (&amp;quot;Board&amp;quot;) at the 
Company&apos;s 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (&amp;quot;2016 Annual 
Meeting&amp;quot;). Mr. Pirnat will continue to serve as a Director until the 
election of Directors at the 2016 Annual Meeting.&amp;nbsp;Mr. Pirnat&apos;s 
decision to resign did not involve any disagreement with the Company, the 
Company&apos;s managers, or the Board of Directors.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On May 13, 2016, 
(the &amp;quot;Company&amp;quot;) received a letter (&amp;quot;Notice&amp;quot;)
from The NASDAQ Stock Market LLC (&amp;quot;Nasdaq&amp;quot;) notifying the 
Company that, because the closing bid price for its Common stock was below $1.00
per share for the previous 30 consecutive business days, it no longer complied 
with the minimum bid price requirement for continued listing on The Nasdaq 
Capital Market pursuant to Nasdaq Marketplace Rule 5550(a)(2).&amp;nbsp; The 
letter also stated that the Company was granted an initial compliance period of 
180 calendar days, or until November 9, 2016, to regain compliance with the 
Minimum Bid Price Requirement pursuant to Nasdaq Marketplace Rule 5810(c)(3)
(A).&amp;nbsp; The letter indicated that if, at any time during the 180 day 
compliance period, the closing bid price of the Common Stock is at least $1.00 
for a minimum of ten consecutive business days, Nasdaq will provide the Company 
with written confirmation that it has achieved compliance with the minimum bid 
price requirement.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On July 8, 2016 
the Company received a letter from Nasdaq notifying the Company that for the 
previous 10 consecutive business days, from June 23 to July 7, 2016, the closing
bid price of the Company&apos;s common stock was $1.00 per share or greater, and
that the Company regained compliance with Marketplace Rule 5550(a)(2) and this 
matter is now closed.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:-.5in;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;On June 20, 2016 
the Company issued a total of 9,081 restricted shares to its CFO. The shares 
were issued as a net settlement of previously granted and vested restricted 
stock units.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
<us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Organization and Line of 
Business&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Parent was 
incorporated on May 5, 2003 in the State of Nevada. The Subsidiary was 
incorporated on March 6, 2002 in the province of Alberta, Canada. 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company provides burner and chemical management 
products and services for the oil and gas industry in the Canadian and US 
markets. &lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
<us-gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustmentDescription
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reclassification&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Certain balances 
in previously issued consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to
be consistent with the current period presentation.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustmentDescription>
<us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The preparation of financial statements in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported 
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and 
liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reportable amounts 
of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could 
differ from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
<us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--
&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Principles of 
Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The consolidated financial statements include our wholly-
owned subsidiary. Intercompany balances and transactions have been 
eliminated.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--
&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic and Diluted Loss Per 
Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The computation of basic loss per share of common stock 
is based on the weighted average number of shares outstanding during the periods
presented using the treasury stock method. The computation of fully diluted loss
per share includes common stock equivalents outstanding at the balance sheet 
date. As of June 30, 2016 and 2015 the Company had 332,794 and 69,190 common 
stock equivalents from equity awards that have been excluded from the 
calculation of diluted loss per share as their effect would have been anti-
dilutive. Basic and diluted loss per share are as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-

<us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Foreign Currency and Comprehensive 
Income&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The&amp;nbsp;functional&amp;nbsp;currency&amp;nbsp;of&amp
;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;Company&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;its&amp;nbsp;subsidiaries&amp;n
bsp;in&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;U.S.&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;Canada&amp;nbsp;are&amp;
nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;U.S.&amp;nbsp;Dollar&amp;nbsp;
(&amp;quot;USD&amp;quot;)&amp;nbsp;and&amp;nbsp;the&amp;nbsp;Canadian&amp;nbsp;D
ollar&amp;nbsp;(&amp;quot;CAD&amp;quot;),&amp;nbsp;respectively. &amp;#160;The 
financial statements of the Company were translated to USD using period end 
exchange rates for the balance sheet, and average exchange rates for the 
statements of operations.&amp;#160; Equity transactions were translated using 
historical rates.&amp;#160; The period-end exchange rates of 0.772081 and 0.7711
were used to convert the Company&amp;#146;s June 30, 2016 and March 31, 2016 
balance sheets, respectively, and the statements of operations used weighted 
average rates of 0.772962 and 0.811950 for the three months ended June 30, 2016 
and 2015, respectively. All amounts in the financial statements and footnotes 
are presumed to be stated in USD, unless otherwise identified. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Foreign currency translation gains or 
losses as a result of fluctuations in the exchange rates are reflected in the 
Consolidated Statement of Operations and Comprehensive Income (Loss), and the 
Consolidated Statements of Stockholders&amp;#146; Equity.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock
contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair 
Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;The fair value of a financial instrument is the amount 
that could be received upon the sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability
in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement 
date.&amp;nbsp;Financial assets are marked to bid prices and financial 
liabilities are marked to offer prices.&amp;nbsp;Fair value measurements do not 
include transaction costs.&amp;nbsp;A fair value hierarchy is used to prioritize
the quality and reliability of the information used to determine fair 
values.&amp;nbsp;Categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based on the 
lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value 
measurement.&amp;nbsp;The fair value hierarchy is defined into the following 
three categories:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 1: Quoted market prices in active markets for 
identical assets or liabilities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 2: Observable market-based inputs or inputs that 
are corroborated by market data.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Level 3: Unobservable inputs that are not corroborated by
market data.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Fair value 
estimates of financial instruments are made at a specific point in time, based 
on relevant information about financial markets and specific financial 
instruments. As these estimates are subjective in nature, involving 
uncertainties and matters of significant judgment, they cannot be determined 
with precision. &amp;nbsp;Changes in assumptions can significantly affect 
estimated fair value.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The carrying value
of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued liabilities 
approximate their fair value because of the short-term nature of these 
instruments. Management is of the opinion that the Company is not exposed to 
significant interest or credit risks arising from these financial 
instruments.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--
egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and 
Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;For purposes of the statement of cash flows, cash and 
cash equivalents include cash and all debt securities with an original maturity 
of 90 days or less. As of June 30, 2016 and March 31, 2016, cash and cash 
equivalents totaled $22,043,090 and $21,292,595 respectively. &lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:TradeAndOtherAccountsReceivablePolicy contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--
egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-
right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Accounts 
Receivable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-
bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;Receivables from the sale of goods and services are 
stated at net realizable value. This value includes an appropriate allowance for
estimated uncollectible accounts. &amp;nbsp;The allowance is calculated based on
past collectability and customer relationships. &amp;nbsp;The Company recorded 
an allowance for doubtful accounts of $268,464 and $250,646 as of June 30, 2016 
and March 31, 2016, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:TradeAndOtherAccountsReceivablePolicy>
<us-gaap:InventoryPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y16Q2'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-
height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventories&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style=&apos;margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;margin-right:4.5pt;text-
align:justify;line-height:12.0pt&apos;&gt;In accordance with ARB No. 43 
&lt;i&gt;&amp;#147;Inventory Pricing,&amp;#148;&lt;/i&gt; the Company&amp;#146;s
inventory is valued at the lower of cost (the purchase price, including 
additional fees) or market based on using the entire value of inventory. 
&amp;nbsp;Inventories are determined based on the average cost basis.&amp;#160; 
Inventory consists of finished goods held for sale and includes the 
following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot;
